marklogic.body:
Someone spoke badly of Apple! Quick, to the spin machine!
"So, as you can see, by our strict scientific methods, the newest should be drooled over like a banana split. A 'tepid' banana split, Depending on your definition of the word 'tepid'."
As you should have been able to tell, the conditions vary wildly. Consumer Reports got the thing up to 116, and you got it up to 108. That's great, but it doesn't mean anything. One test during one run of a game doesn't prove squat.
When new video cards come out, they are tested over and over and over again and then the mean is taken. Sometimes, game X (probably still Crysis for some reason) will run at 80 FPS, and then at 100 FPS, and then at 45 FPS, all seemingly from the same starting point (Cold machine, just rebooted, etc.). If I reported just the highest or just the lowest, I would be lying to the consumer.
